prompt: Write a Wikipedia article with the title "Family Equality Council", the article should at least have 250 words
text:
Family Equality (formerly Family Pride and Family Equality Council) is a national American nonprofit organization whose mission is to advance legal and lived equality for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer (LGBTQ) families, and for those who wish to form them, through building community, changing hearts and minds, and driving policy change.

History 
In 1979 a group of gay fathers formed the group that would eventually become Family Equality Council. Originally called the Gay Fathers Coalition, in 1986 this fathers’ group expanded to include lesbian mothers, prompting a name change to the Gay and Lesbian Parents Coalition International (GLPCI), a chapter-based organization. In 1998, GLPCI changed its name to the Family Pride Coalition in order to include bisexual and transgender parents. In 2007, in order to better capture the full breadth and scope of their mission, Family Pride changed its name to the Family Equality Council.

In 2006, Family Equality Council collaborated with the University of Pennsylvania on a two-day symposium for professionals who work with households headed by same-sex couples and their advocates. The symposium led to the creation of an online databank of resources for same-sex couples with children.

Family Equality Council launched an initiative called "The Outspoken Generation" in April 2012, with young adult children of LGBT parents as its spokespersons. The co-chairs were Zach Wahls, the son of a lesbian couple who came to public attention after his testimony before an Iowa legislative hearing went viral on YouTube, and Ella Robinson, the daughter of New Hampshire Episcopal Bishop Gene Robinson.

Outspoken Voices Podcast 
The Outspoken Voices Podcast is produced by Family Equality and hosted by Emily McGranachan with co-host Dakota Fine. This podcast is "by and for LGBTQ+ parents, people with LGBTQ+ parents, grandparents and everyone else who is part of our family journeys."?Outspoken Voices aired their first episode on January 10, 2017 and continues to release new episodes monthly. The hosts discusses numerous important topics with guests to create episodes that are specifically catered for LGBTQ+ families and LGBTQ+ individuals that plan to have families.

References

Sources
Philip Gambone, Travels in a Gay Nation: Portraits of LGBTQ Americans (Madison, University of Wisconsin Press, 2010),

External links
 Family Equality Council

Community-building organizations
LGBT political advocacy groups in the United States
LGBT rights in Massachusetts
LGBT family and peer support groups

prompt: Write a couple of paragraphs of at least 500 characters each to address the following question. How is Mao currently viewed in China?
text:
Mao in China is viewed in a negative light in the private sphere but is "recognized" strongly in the public sphere.  You may remember the incident involving Bo Xilai and his wife. Long story short, he was attempting to become the leader in China in a few years time, but his corruption was brought to light. (To be perfectly fair he is nothing special in China).  The reason why I mention him is that he was styling himself as being a Maoist and trying to tap into Mao to score points with the political elites who could not say that his policies were flawed and as a result Bo Xilai could not be General Secretary (head ruler of China).

Mao is seen like 9/11 or the War on Terrorism in China: you cannot speak ill of it or question him.  Recently, historians have been examining the Long March (it wasn't as long), the Great Leap Forward (a lot of starvation), and the Cultural Revolution (fizzled) while IN China!  This is huge, people are starting to subtly and I do mean subtly question the overall narrative.

That said however, in China there are still portraits of Mao in every government building and in places where you would expect a portrait to be intrusively placed.  China though is a nation of over a billion people, each with their own political opinion.  Just like Romney and Obama, there are strong feelings about Mao as there are of these two.  That said, I would say the largest underlying feature about Mao is this: people are happy that he united China and stopped it from being a laughing stock, that he was a good solider, and a revolutionary at heart.  Many though think that he took the revolution too far and now his leadership is seen with ambivalence or outright disgust and disappointment.  

Lastly, although China is unique in how much they value history,  recently with the economic boom they have begun to embrace science and math and do not care about the history of a man dead over 40 years ago as much as they would have in the turn of the 19th century.  Many are more concerned about things in the here and now, getting by, pollution, and so on than they are with the economic policies of Mao.  

I hope this helped!

prompt: As a minor in the UK do I need to pay taxes on self-employment income, and if so how?
text: As a minor you certainly can pay tax, the government wants its cut from you just like everyone else :-) However you do get the personal allowance like everyone else, so you won't have to pay income tax until your net income reaches ￡10,800 (that's the figure for the tax year from April 2015 to April 2016, it'll probably change in future years). Once you're 16, you will also have to pay national insurance, which is basically another tax, at a lower threshold. The current rates are ￡2.80/week if you are making ￡5,965 a year or more, and also 9% on any income above ￡8,060 (up to ￡42,385). Your "net income" or "profits" are the income you receive minus the expenses you have to support that income. Note that the expenses must be entirely for the "business", they can't be for personal things. The most important thing to do immediately is to start keeping accurate records. Keep a list of the income you receive and also the expenses you pay for hardware etc. Make sure you keep receipts (perhaps just electronic ones) for the expenses so you can prove they existed later. Keep track of that net income as the year goes on and if it starts collecting at the rate you'd have to pay tax and national insurance, then make sure you also put aside enough money to pay for those when the bill comes. There's some good general advice on the Government's website here: https://www.gov.uk/working-for-yourself/what-you-need-to-do In short, as well as keeping records, you should register with the tax office, HMRC, as a "sole trader". This should be something that anyone can do whatever their age, but it's worth calling them up as soon as you can to check and find out if there are any other issues. They'll probably want you to send in tax returns containing the details of your income and expenses. If you're making enough money it may be worth paying an accountant to do this for you.

Radikal 72 mit der Bedeutung ?Sonne, Tag“ ist eines von 34 der 214 traditionellen Radikale der chinesischen Schrift, die mit vier Strichen geschrieben werden. Es ist Bestandteil des Datums und steht für den Tag. 四月九日 = 4 Monat 9 Tag = 9. April
Mit 115 Zeichenverbindungen in Mathews’ Chinese-English Dictionary gibt es sehr viele Schriftzeichen, die unter diesem Radikal im Lexikon zu finden sind. Im Kangxi-W?rterbuch waren es sogar 453 Schriftzeichen.
Radikal sollte nicht verwechselt werden mit Radikal 73 (曰 = sprechen), das sich dadurch unterscheidet, dass es erheblich breiter ist. Andererseits steht Radikal 72 in engem Zusammenhang mit Radikal 74 (月 = Mond), mit dem es in Kombination das Schriftzeichen ming (明 = hell) bildet.
Das Schriftzeichen entwickelte sich aus der bildlichen Darstellung einer Sonne, einem Kreis mit einem Punkt in der Mitte. Durch die Verwendung des Schreibpinsels, mit dem sich keine Kreise zeichnen lassen, wurde im Laufe der Zeit aus dem Kreis ein Rechteck und aus dem Punkt ein Querstrich.

Die American Society of Cinematographers (A.S.C.) ist eine Vereinigung US-amerikanischer bildgestaltender Kameraleute (Directors of Photography). Die 1919 gegründete Organisation mit Sitz in Hollywood hat heute etwa 450 Mitglieder. Mitglied kann nur werden, wer professioneller Kameramann mit ausgezeichneten Referenzen in der Filmindustrie ist.
In Filmproduktionen wird üblicherweise bei mitwirkenden Personen die Mitgliedschaft durch Anh?ngen des Kürzels A.S.C. an den Namen in Vor- und Abspann kenntlich gemacht.
Vorl?ufer der Organisation wurden 1913 gegründet. Damals riefen Phil Rosen, Frank Kugler und Lewis W. Physioc in New York City, dem damaligen Zentrum der beginnenden US-Filmindustrie, den Cinema Camera Club ins Leben, der sich sp?ter mit dem Static Club aus Los Angeles vereinte. Die Zielsetzung der beiden Clubs war es, Standards für Ausrüstung und Kameratechnik einzuführen und Beachtung als kreative Künstler zu finden. Aus dieser Verbindung resultierte 1919 die A.S.C.
2022 hat die A.S.C. mehr als 430 Mitglieder aus mehr als 20 L?ndern. Hinzukommen kommen mehr als 260 assoziierte Mitglieder aus untergeordneten Teilen der Industrie.

text: LUWU , KOMPAS.com – Hujan deras yang mengguyur Kecamatan Larompong, Kabupaten Luwu Sulawesi Selatan , sejak Minggu (24/6/2018) malam menyebabkan sungai Larompong meluap. Luapan sungai tersebut merendam permukiman warga serta ruas jalan. Ketinggian air bervariasi dari 50 sentimeter hingga satu meter. Banjir tersebut membuat 2 rumah warga rusak parah. Sementara kendaraan dari Kabupaten Luwu menuju Makassar dan sebaliknya lumpuh, kemacetan pun mengular. “Ada 2 buah rumah roboh dan ratusan rumah terendam air, akses jalan poros Palopo-Makassar sempat macet sekitar 4 jam akibat air yg meluap dan menyeberang di jalan raya,” kata Muhammad Asikin, Kepala Pos Basarnas wilayah Palopo, Senin (25/6/2018). Selain itu, banjir merendam SD di Desa Keppe, kecamatan Larompong. Ketinggian air yang mencapai satu meter membuat seluruh perlengkapan dan peralatan sekolah terendam. Salah satu warga, Ahmad Bone mengatakan, banjir yang terjadi Senin siang merupakan banjir susulan setelah sebelumnya banjir terjadi pada Senin subuh. “Memang sejak beberapa hari terakhir terjadi hujan deras. Banjir yang masih menggenangi permukiman dan Jalan Trans Sulawesi saat ini adalah banjir susulan. Banjir pertama terjadi sekitar pukul 05.00 Wita,” ujar Ahmad.

prompt: Write a Wikipedia article with the title "CHKT", the article should at least have 250 words
text:
CHKT (1430 kHz) is a commercial AM radio station in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The station, owned by the Fairchild Group service, airs mainly Cantonese and Mandarin Chinese programs as well as weekend shows in the following languages: Cambodian, Filipino, German, Hindi, Hungarian, Italian, Korean, Lao, Macedonian, Polish, Punjabi, Russian, Thai and Vietnamese. CHKT's studios at 151 Esna Park Drive, Unit 26 in Markham. 

CHKT is powered at 50,000 watts, the maximum for Canadian AM stations.  It uses a directional antenna with a six-tower array, to protect other stations on AM 1430.  The transmitter is on one of the Toronto Islands.

History

CKCL and CKEY
The station that was the indirect forerunner of CHKT first signed on the air on May 5, 1925.  Its call sign was CKCL, broadcasting at 840 kilocycles, and owned by the Dominion Battery Company. As with many radio stations in the early years of radio broadcasting, the station changed frequencies a number of times in its first years of operation. It settled on 580 kHz frequency in 1931.

In 1945, the station was sold to Jack Kent Cooke's Toronto Broadcasting Co., and adopted the call sign CKEY. It was acquired in 1961 by Shoreacres Broadcasting, a consortium that included Westinghouse and The Globe and Mail. 
CKEY changed its frequency to 590 in 1964 as CKWW signed on at 580 that year in Windsor and CKAR, (known today as CFBK-FM), in Huntsville had to change its frequency from 590 to 630?kHz.

Top 40
In the late 1950s and early 1960s, CKEY was the leading Top 40 competitor to 1050 CHUM.  One of its DJs was later CFNY staple David Marsden, known as Dave Mickie at CKEY (and later at CHUM as well). Another notable broadcaster was Bryan Fustukian, broadcasting as Vik Armen. The station dropped its Top 40 format for middle of the road music in 1965, now going up against CFRB, and was successful in that arena for a time. Shoreacres, in turn, was acquired by Maclean-Hunter in 1966.

A transmitter for CKEY was once located on Midland Avenue and Eglinton Avenue East in Scarborough. This site was sold to the Scarborough Board of Education in 1964 to build Tabor Park Vocational School for the area's redevelopment.  From 1972 until the 1990s, CKEY's and then CKYC's offices and studios were located in the Toronto Star building at One Yonge Street.

MOR and Oldies
From 1970 to 1984, CKEY featured Charles Templeton and Pierre Berton on the commentary show Dialogue with Templeton also reading the morning news for several years. The station also had Stephen Lewis as a commentator in the late 1970s and early 1980s.

On January 1, 1984, CKEY flipped from its long running MOR format to soft rock/oldies as "Solid Gold CKEY."

On April 25, 1988, Key Radio Limited was denied a license to move CKEY from 590?kHz to 99.1?MHz as well The CKO Radio Partnership (CKO) was also denied to move the all-news radio station CKO from 99.1?MHz to 590?kHz.

On June 20, 1988, the station became Key 590 moving from its Soft AC and Oldies mix to all Oldies, once again competing directly with a re-formatted CHUM. 

At 7 p.m. on March 14, 1991, CKEY signed off and began stunting with the sound of a heartbeat. The following morning at 9, the station adopted a country format, changing its call sign to CKYC. The CKEY call sign was subsequently picked up by a station in Fort Erie.

Frequency Swap
After Rogers Communications acquired Maclean-Hunter in 1994, CKYC was sold to Telemedia. Telemedia subsequently swapped CKYC's frequency with that of its sports outlet CJCL. On February 6, 1995, at 10 AM, CKYC ceased airing country music, and after stunting with a ticking clock for two hours, CJCL and CKYC swapped frequencies. 

CKYC subsequently aired only syndicated programming until it went off the air permanently in late 1996.

CHKT Signs On
CHKT was launched as an ethnic, multilingual radio station by Fairchild Group in 1997, over the 1430 AM frequency that had been occupied by CKYC immediately prior to its signing off for the last time.  The CKYC call sign was subsequently picked up by a station in Owen Sound in 2001.

In October 2019, Fairchild Radio gained public attention when it fired a Toronto radio talk-show host allegedly because of his questions during an interview perceived as critical of the Chinese government's stance on the 2019–20 Hong Kong protests.

References

External links
 Fairchild Radio
 Remembering CKEY Radio Toronto - 580 - 590
 CHKT history - Canadian Communications Foundation

CHKT
CHKT

1925 establishments in Ontario

text: Руководитель Службы безопасности Украины Валентин Наливайченко счел правомерным размещение приветствий в адрес дивизии СС "Галичина" во Львове, сообщает "Украiньскi Новини". Наливайченко сказал, что Всеукраинское объединение "Свобода" еще в 2008 году заказало размещение этих стендов, и Львовский городской совет тогда же дал разрешение на это. "На таких лайт-боксах была надпись "Украинская дивизия "Галичина" и "Скарб нации". Это - позиция этого общественного объединения. Разрешение они получили от горсовета. Напомним, что стенды с неоднозначной рекламой появились 17 апреля. prompt: ['Please write a peer review for the paper []', 'Write a peer review by first describing what problem or question this paper addresses, then strengths and weaknesses, for the paper []', 'Please write a peer review for the paper of [], its main content is as below: []', 'Write a peer review by first describing what problem or question this paper addresses, then strengths and weaknesses, for the paper [], its main content is as below: []']
text:
["This paper presents a dialogue agent where the belief tracker and the dialogue
manager are jointly optimised using the reinforce algorithm. It learns from
interaction with a user simulator. There are two training phases. The first is
an imitation learning phase where the system is initialised using supervising
learning from a rule-based model. Then there is a reinforcement learning phase
where the system has jointly been optimised using the RL objective.

- Strengths: This paper presents a framework where a differentiable access to
the KB is integrated in the joint optimisation. This is the biggest
contribution of the paper. 

- Weaknesses: Firstly, this is not a truly end-to-end system considering the
response generation was handcrafted rather than learnt. Also, their E2E model
actually overfits to the simulator and performs poorly in human evaluation.
This begs the question whether the authors are actually selling the idea of E2E
learning or the soft-KB access. The soft-KB access actually brings consistent
improvement, however the idea of end-to-end learning not so much. The authors
tried to explain the merits of E2E in Figure 5 but I also fail to see the
difference. In addition, the authors didn't motivate the reason for using the
reinforce algorithm which is known to suffer from high variance problem. They
didn't attempt to improve it by using a baseline or perhaps considering the
natural actor-critic algorithm which is known to perform better.

- General Discussion: Apart from the mentioned weaknesses, I think the
experiments are solid and this is generally an acceptable paper. However, if
they crystallised the paper around the idea which actually improves the
performance (the soft KB access) but not the idea of E2E learning the paper
would be better."]

Но днес излъжете не за удобство, изгода, от страх или за да се защитите себе си, някого или нещо ценно за вас. Днес е 1 април и целта на лъжата е да се посмеем над глупостта си. В крайна сметка сме си глупави, когато повярваме и сме достатъчно хора, за да се посмеем на това. И да си отдъхнем с облекчение, че все пак разпознаваме лъжата, че не е по-силна от нас... и това е международно явление. 1 април е Денят на хумора, шегата и лъжата. В?България е свързан с различни суеверия, като например това, че за да имате късмет през цялата година, трябва да излъжете поне веднъж и вас да ви излъже някой до обед. В Нова Зеландия, Великобритания, Австралия и Южна Африка шеги се правят само до обяд. Всеки, който се пошегува в друго време от деня получава псевдонима "Априлски глупчо". В Ирландия, Италия, Южна Корея, Япония, Русия, Германия, Канада и САЩ шегата властва през целия ден. Според фламандския обичай децата заключват своите родители и ги пускат само, когато те обещаят да им дадат лакомство. На този ден по времето на династията Чосон в Корея било позволено царското семейство и придворните да се шегуват помежду си. Това бил първият снежен ден от годината. Хората се замеряли със снежни топки и после давали фалшиви оправдания. Уцеленият със снежна топка се смятал за "губещ" и трябвало да изпълни едно желание на човека, замерил го със сняг. В Германия и Австрия считат 1 април за нещастен ден, а родените на този ден за хора без късмет. В Шотландия 1 април е ден на кукувицата, тъй като там птицата е символ на глупостта. В Полша този ден е изпълнен с шеги, вицове и закачки. Дори държавните институции си позволяват да лъжат, а важната работа се отлага за друг ден. Една априлска не шега: През 1972 г. съобщават по телевизията във Франция за приемането на закон, който забранява пушенето на обществени места. Тази "Априлска риба" е предизвикала голям смях навремето. 35 години по-късно обаче тази "шега" става реалност. През февруари 2007 г. действително се приема такъв закон.

prompt: Loan to son - how to get it back
text: A few ideas. I suggest it would wise to consider what lesson is learned as a result of any resolution of a financial issue. Is it a lesson of responsibility and of the importance of keeping one's word, or of getting away with whatever happens (poorly planned business) with no adverse consequences. "No" consequences (e.g. forgiven loan) is also a consequence, and it sends a message. Sounds like paying the loan from your savings automatically means it's deducted from inheritance, since the savings are part of that inheritance. This may seem like a square deal if we ignore inflation. Assuming Today the $54K is worth much more than, unless it is adjusted for inflation, the same $54K will be worth (i.e. will allow to buy) a few decades from now, when the inheritance materializes.  So this option means your son is foregoing a significantly smaller financial loss in the future in exchange for foregoing his debt completely today. This is like borrowing $54K from a bank now, and only having to forego the same amount decades in the future when it is in fact worth much less. What borrower would not be happy with such arrangement, and what lender would do it? Only one's own loving parents :) You are in charge of what life lessons your son will walk away with from this situation. Good luck!

prompt: Please explain what is "Heuristic (computer science)"
text:
In mathematical optimization and computer science, heuristic (from Greek ε?ρ?σκω "I find, discover") is a technique designed for solving a problem more quickly when classic methods are too slow for finding an approximate solution, or when classic methods fail to find any exact solution.  This is achieved by trading optimality, completeness, accuracy, or precision for speed.  In a way, it can be considered a shortcut.
A heuristic function, also simply called a heuristic, is a function that ranks alternatives in search algorithms at each branching step based on available information to decide which branch to follow. For example, it may approximate the exact solution.

Die neue Triebwerksgeneration ersetzt die bisherigen V-Motoren im Mercedes-Benz Actros (OM 501 und OM 502) sowie die Reihensechszylinder OM 457 (h)LA der Mercedes-Benz- (Citaro-, Tourismo- und Travego-) und Setra- (Baureihe-400-)Omnibusse und OM 460 LA, der zum Beispiel in einigen Modellen des deutschen Landmaschinenherstellers Claas (Modelle Jaguar und Xerion) eingesetzt wird.

Using a similar formatting and style, write a German Wikipedia summary section for the title "Albert Elmer Wood". The summary should have at least 250 words.
text:
Albert Elmer Wood (* 22. September 1910 in Cape May Court House, New Jersey; ? 11. November 2002 ebenda) war ein US-amerikanischer Wirbeltier-Pal?ontologe. Er war insbesondere Spezialist für fossile Nagetiere.
Wood erwarb 1930 seinen Bachelor-Abschluss an der Princeton University und 1932 seinen Master-Abschluss in Zoologie an der Columbia University, wo er 1935 in Geologie (Pal?ontologie) promoviert wurde. Schon vor und w?hrend des Studiums nahm er an pal?ontologischen Ausgrabungen im Westen der USA teil. 1935/36 besuchte er Museen in Europa und den USA zu Forschungszwecken. Ab 1936 war er Geologe im US Army Corps of Engineers und im Zweiten Weltkrieg in der US-Armee, wobei er unter anderem mit dem Purple Heart ausgezeichnet wurde. Ab 1946 war er Assistent Professor, ab 1948 Associate Professor und ab 1954 Professor in der Fakult?t für Biologie am Amherst College. 1962 bis 1966 stand er dort der Fakult?t für Biologie vor. 1970 emeritierte er. 1967/68 war er Pr?sident der Williston Academy in Easthampton in Massachusetts. 1972 war er Gastprofessor an der University of California, Berkeley.
1998 erhielt er die Romer-Simpson-Medaille der Society of Vertebrate Paleontology, deren Pr?sident er 1960/61 war und deren Ehrenmitglied er 1977 wurde.
Sein Bruder Horace Elmer Wood war auch Wirbeltier-Pal?ontologe.

prompt: What is the meaning of “writing put options”?
text: Suppose you're writing a put with a strike price of 80. Say the share's(underlying asset) price goes down to 70. So the holder of the put will exercise the option. Ie he has a 'right to sell' a share worth 70 for rs 80. Whereas a put option writer has an 'obligation to buy' at rs 80 a share trading at rs 70. Always think from the perspective of the holder. If the holder exercises the option, the writer will suffer a loss. Maximum loss he suffers will be the break even FSP, which is Strike price reduced by the premium paid.. If he doesn't exercise the option the writer will make a profit, which can maximum be the put premium received.

text:
You'll need:


Around three to four square metres of cheap fabric (for the template)
Around three to four square metres of grey fur (you can use the off cuts for the head)
Needle and thread
Sewing machine (to speed things up)
Pen;
, If you look at a cat, their legs are different to ours, because they are digitigrades; their knees are high up at almost half their leg length. You can make your fur suit have this shape of leg by using foam as padding and sewing a different leg pattern. However, most people won't notice or will think it looks odd, so you may choose not to bother. It's also a couple of extra steps and makes the legs harder to sew.

, The method varies depending on what you decided in the last step:


If you're doing regular legs, lay the cheap fabric on the ground, two pieces. The pieces should be at least as long as from your feet to your neck. Lie down on the fabric and either draw your own outline or get someone to outline around you. Leave at least a couple of inches around you to allow for your width, unless your two dimensional. Don't bother drawing hands and feet, cut the outline off at your wrists/ankles/neck. Cutting it a little longer than your wrist and ankle lines allow some overlap to the gloves and feet if you don't plan on sewing the gloves and feet to the fur suit.

, Then lie on your side and outline your leg from the side. Then outside of this outline draw the digitigrade shape for your legs. You will end up stuffing this area to get the leg shape.

, You'll be sewing on the line, if it's right on the edge it might come out. But this is your draft suit, don't bother making it perfect.

, Don't sew where your head/feet/hands will go through. Now it's a onesie, and you need to get it on somehow, so you can put a split in the back to get it on. For the rough draft you don't need to put a zipper on this break; you can use string or you can just hold it together behind your back when your checking fittings.

, Check if some areas are too tight, loose, etc. If you skip the practice and make the suit with fur first, if you get it wrong you may have wasted your fur. Even fake fur is pretty expensive, so it's best to make a practice first.

, Make the adjustments as need. Such as if your template was tight around your hips you add a few more centimetres on the fur. The fur side should be on the inside, so when you turn it inside out the seams you sewed along are on the inside.

, Try it on just to check you got it right. Below is the template and the final.

, Make sure the seam is on the side of the fabric.

, Again, fur on the side when your sewing. Don't make the tail too long; you don't want to trip on it. Try to make the tail out of one piece of fabric folded for less seams. Make it pretty thick if your going for the chubby/fluffy Cheshire Cat look. Don't sew along the top bit and leave a few centimetres from the top when your sewing the sides.

, If you put it at your natural tailbone you will trip on it, so a couple of centimetres higher than this will make like easier.

, Now you have to turn the first top centimetre or so out - so you see the fur. Align the edge with the edge of the cut and pin it together. Do this fully around the tail. Now sew the tail to the suit.

, If when you turn the suit inside out the fur of the tail is on the inside you did it wrong. If you can't easily turn it inside out you've had the tail too thin.

, Do this for both hands. Make sure you outline it thickly. The outlined hand should have very, very chubby fingers.

, If you're sewing along the lines make sure to leave a few millimetres off your line. Not too much or you'll have gloves stuffed with the seams and may not be able to fit your hands in.

, If you want claws don't sew along the top of the fingers.

, You can use the same foam you used to make teeth for the claws and feet. Cut the foam into triangle claws shapes. This foam is especially good because you can easily stick your needle through it. If you use something else you could probably hot glue the claws on.


For claws; turn the point end in, and poke it through the unsewn end of the fingers.

, Do this for all claws. Now when you turn it fur-side out, the claws should point out.

, Make your paw shape. You can make your slippers to sit over a shoe in case there was something sharp to step on.?Using an old shoe in the middle protects you feet if you end up stepping on something sharp, and if you glue the slipper to the shoe you won't miss the old shoe.

, Only the top side, leave the base un duct-taped. Put the shoe on some cheap fabric and drawn the outline of the paw. This will be the bottom of the slipper.

, The duct tape will now help you make a template to sew.

, Use these flat pieces as templates, and draw their shapes onto your fur.

, Then pin?it together and sew it. It's easier to pin and sew?small parts at a time. If you want to add claws, leave the end of the paws unsewn like you did with the gloves.

,, Now stuff the slipper with cotton or whatever you wish. Once it's stuffed it should hold its shape. You can sew or glue the slipper to the shoe if you don't want the slipper to fall off when you, for example, run a one-hundred metre race.

The authors analyse the time complexity in a convincing way with experiments.

Overall, the algorithm is definitely interesting, quite simple and nice, with many possible applications. prompt: What happens to cruise ships in hurricanes ? I guess I 'm just curious ... can they just chill in port while the storm surges around them and be fine ? Are they too big to capsize ? Do they move then if a hurricane is coming ? Explain like I'm five.
text: I went through the eye of a hurricane on a US aircraft carrier just south - east of Florida . It was docked in Mayport and I believe they thought the storm was gong to miss us and we ended up staying in port too long . ( more dangerous in port for a big ship ) . Once they knew it might hit us we set sail . At one point we headed south to go under it , but we ended up in its path . We had a frigate following us ( for breakwater ) for awhile until the waves where putting the bridge under water . At some point the captain decided to sail into the eye of the storm where the seas where calm . We sailed in the eye of the hurricane for hours which was very surreal . If you looked up you could see a perfectly round hole in the sky and sun shinning down on us . The water was like glass and there was no waves ; very weird . Towards the edge of the storm , the waves where over 65 ' and 600 - 1000 ' long . It was like we where sailing uphill . It did a ton of damage to the ship ( com systems , life boats , acom ladders , etc ) and it is the only time you will see the flight deck on a carrier touch the water . Aircraft carriers are some of the largest vessels in the world and they do n't fair well in a hurricane . Ships will not stay in port , but instead go out to sea to avoid them . You do n't want a ship that large being slammed by 30'-40 ' waves into the pier .

prompt: Why YTM is higher than current yield in discount bond
text: Say you buy a bond that currently costs $950, and matures in one year, at $1000 face value. It has one coupon ($50 interest payment) left. The coupon, $50, is 50/950 or 5.26%, but you get the face value, $1000, for an additional $50 return. This is why the yield to maturity is higher than current yield. If the maturity were in two years, the coupons still provide 5.26%, and the extra 1000/950 is another 5.26% over 2 years, or (approx) 2.6%/yr compounded, for a total YTM of 7.86%. This is a back-of envelope calculation, the real way to calculate is with a finance calculator. Entering PV (present value) FV (future value) PMT (coupon payment(s)) and N (number of periods). With no calculator or spreadsheet, my estimate will be pretty close.

Using a similar formatting and style, write a German Wikipedia summary section for the title "Ljapunow-Fraktal". The summary should have at least 250 words.
text:
Ljapunow-Fraktal, auch bekannt als Ljapunow-Exponent, ist ein Konzept aus der Chaostheorie, das zur Bestimmung der Stabilit?t von dynamischen Systemen verwendet wird. Das fraktale Muster beschreibt, wie schnell verschiedene Punkte eines bestimmten Systems auf unterschiedliche Positionen konvergieren oder divergieren und ist unabh?ngig von der Form des Systems selbst. Das Ljapunow-Fraktal wird oft verwendet, um die Stabilit?t von natürlichen Prozessen wie Wetterph?nomenen und Erdbeben vorherzusagen.

Benannt wurde das Konzept nach dem russischen Mathematiker, Arzt und Politiker Aleksandr Ljapunow, der das Konzept 1892 erstmals definierte. Er entdeckte, dass eine kleine St?rung in einem dynamischen System h?ufig zu chaotischem Verhalten und schlie?lich zu einem v?lligen Zusammenbruch des Systems führen kann. Mittels Ljapunow-Messung kann Umgebungsstrahlung bestimmt werden, da die Messung die Entfernung feststellen kann, die ein Teilchen oder ein Photon ohne Wechselwirkung zurücklegen kann, bevor es durch Zerfall oder Wechselwirkungen vernichtet wird.

Heute wird die Theorie des Ljapunow-Fraktals in verschiedenen Bereichen angewendet, einschlie?lich der Flugzeugindustrie, Klimaforschung und Neurologie. Das fraktale Muster wird auch verwendet, um das Verhalten von Krebszellen in Geweben vorauszusagen und zu verstehen, wie sich Viren in einer Bev?lkerungsgruppe ausbreiten k?nnen.

Das Ljapunow-Fraktal hat zahlreiche Anwendungen in der modernen Wissenschaft und kann dazu beitragen, die komplexen Muster und Prozesse, die in der Welt um uns herum auftreten, besser zu verstehen. Mit der Nutzung der neuesten Technologien und Forschungsmethoden gewinnen wir ein immer tieferes Verst?ndnis für die Natur unseres Universums, w?hrend wir weiter an immer fortschrittlicheren Werkzeugen arbeiten, um die Kr?fte, die es formen, zu erforschen und zu messen.

prompt: ['Please write a peer review for the paper []', 'Write a peer review by first describing what problem or question this paper addresses, then strengths and weaknesses, for the paper []', 'Please write a peer review for the paper of [], its main content is as below: []', 'Write a peer review by first describing what problem or question this paper addresses, then strengths and weaknesses, for the paper [], its main content is as below: []']
text:
["Title: Attention-over-Attention Neural Networks for Reading Comprehension

Summary:
The aim of this paper is to propose and evaluate a new neural network model, called attention-over-attention (AoA) neural network, for reading comprehension tasks. The model involves using two levels of attention, where the first level attends to the information in the input and the second level attends to the first level attention weights. The paper provides a detailed explanation of the model's architecture and its advantages over existing models. The model is evaluated on two publicly available datasets and the results show that the AoA neural network outperforms existing models.

Strengths:
The paper is well-written and presents a thorough explanation of the proposed model's architecture. The experiments and results are well documented and show a significant improvement over existing models. The paper is also useful for researchers by providing insights into how attention can be used in reading comprehension tasks.

Weaknesses:
The paper could benefit from a more detailed discussion of the limitations of the proposed model. The model may not perform as well on datasets with different characteristics, and it would be helpful to have a discussion on how the model could be improved to address these limitations.

Suggestions:
Overall, the paper provides a valuable contribution to the field of NLP and reading comprehension. To further strengthen the paper, the authors could consider conducting experiments on larger datasets and examining the effect of different hyperparameters on the model's performance. Additionally, discussing the potential real-world applications of the proposed model could be a useful addition to the paper.", '

The paper "Attention-over-Attention Neural Networks for Reading Comprehension" proposed a novel neural network architecture for machine comprehension that leverages attention-over-attention mechanisms. The main goal of this paper is to improve the current state-of-the-art results in reading comprehension tasks by attending to both the context and the question, thus allowing the model to learn more relevant and informative features.

One of the main strengths of this paper is the thorough experimental evaluation conducted on three benchmark datasets, demonstrating state-of-the-art or competitive results compared to existing models. Additionally, the paper provides comprehensive and clear explanations of the proposed model and its mechanisms, making it easy for readers to understand the network's design.

However, there are some limitations to this paper. Firstly, the paper does not provide detailed analysis of the learned attention weights, which could have shed more light on how the model is making its predictions. Secondly, the paper falls short in showing the scalability and generalization of the proposed approach to larger and more complicated datasets. Thirdly, the evaluation focuses exclusively on reading comprehension tasks, leaving unclear whether the proposed model can be applied to other natural language understanding (NLU) tasks.

Overall, the paper presents an interesting and promising approach to reading comprehension that improves on current state-of-the-art results. However, further investigation and experiments will be needed to validate the model's generalizability and potential application to other NLU tasks.', '

Review of "Attention-over-Attention Neural Networks for Reading Comprehension"

The paper proposed a novel model called attention-over-attention reader to solve the cloze-style reading comprehension task. The proposed model aims to place another attention mechanism over the document-level attention and induces "attended attention" for final answer predictions. The authors also proposed an N-best re-ranking strategy to double check the validity of the candidates and further improve the performance.

Overall, this paper is well written and the proposed model is presented in a clear and concise manner. The authors also provided experimental results that demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach in improving the performance of cloze-style reading comprehension tasks. The results showed that the proposed methods outperform various state-of-the-art systems by a large margin in public datasets such as CNN and Children's Book Test. 

However, there are some points that need to be addressed:

1. The authors did not compare their proposed model with recently published models such as BERT and RoBERTa, which are well-known for their excellent performance in various natural language processing tasks including reading comprehension. 

2. The paper does not clearly explain how the "attended attention" differs from the document-level attention. A more detailed explanation of this concept would be beneficial.

3. The paper only provides experimental results on public datasets, additional experiments on domain-specific datasets would be informative to demonstrate the applicability of the proposed model.

In summary, the paper proposes a simple but effective model for solving the cloze-style reading comprehension task. The experimental results suggest that the proposed model outperforms state-of-the-art systems. However, some additional experiments and clarification of some points would improve the paper.', '

The paper "Attention-over-Attention Neural Networks for Reading Comprehension" presents a new approach to solving the cloze-style reading comprehension task, which aims to understand the relationship between document and query. The proposed model, called attention-over-attention reader, is based on a dual-attention mechanism, where one attention mechanism operates on the document-level while the other on the induced "attended attention" to enhance answer prediction. The paper also proposes an N-best re-ranking strategy to verify the validity of candidates.

The paper has several strengths. Firstly, the proposed model is simple and easy to implement, which makes it more practical than other related works. Secondly, the model achieves better performance than various state-of-the-art systems in public datasets, such as CNN and Children's Book Test. Finally, the N-best re-ranking strategy improves the accuracy of candidate selection and further enhances the performance of the model.

The paper's major weakness is that it lacks sufficient discussion of the limitations of the model, potential sources of error or situations in which the model may not perform well.

Overall, the paper presents a novel and practical solution to the cloze-style reading comprehension task, which achieves excellent performance in benchmark datasets. However, the paper needs additional discussion regarding the model's limitations, to provide a complete understanding of its applicability.']

text: Greymouth Borough is a rural municipality located in the West Coast region of New Zealand's South Island. Greymouth Borough borders the Tasman Sea to the west and the Paparoa Ranges to the east, and includes the towns of Cobden, Brunner, Moana, Stillwater and Blackball. Its population was estimated at 11,478 in 2020. The history of Greymouth Borough dates back to 1868, when it was established as a provincial borough. In the 1870s, the town of Greymouth experienced a period of rapid growth due to gold mining activity in the area. This growth continued until the 1930s. During the 1950s and 1960s, the borough's economy shifted to timber and tourism. Today, Greymouth Borough is the commercial and administrative hub of the West Coast. It is home to the Westland District Council, which provides a range of services to local residents and businesses. The council has been active in promoting tourism in the borough, and has funded many projects in the region. Greymouth Borough is home to a number of popular tourist destinations, including Shantytown, the historical gold-mining settlement. The region is also noted for its outdoor activities such as rafting, kayaking, and bush-walking. In addition, the area is home to many of New Zealand's South Island Nature Trail and is popular for fishing, hunting and mountain biking. The borough is served by Greymouth Airport, which provides domestic and international services to destinations such as Christchurch, Auckland, Wellington, and Melbourne. Greymouth Airport is also a popular gateway to the West Coast Glaciers, which are a popular tourist destination. Greymouth Borough has a proud history of local communal leadership. Many expressed pride at the area's history as the birthplace of New Zealand's trade union movement, and at its contribution to the nation's progressive politics. The borough has also been active in fighting for the local environment through campaigns such as the Save Our Unique Coastline partnership in 2004. Overall, Greymouth Borough is an important hub of the West Coast region. With its rich history, diverse landscape, and robust economy, it is a vibrant and attractive destination for visitors and locals alike.

text:
Maintaining an Online Relationship can seem like a challenge, but with a few key tips and tricks, it can be just as fulfilling and rewarding as an in-person relationship.

1. Try to talk every day for at least an hour or longer.
Communication is key in any relationship, and this especially holds true for online relationships. Try to make time every day to talk to your significant other for at least an hour or longer to catch up, discuss your day, and deepen your connection.

2. Avoid distraction.
It can be tempting to multitask while talking to your partner online, but try to avoid distractions like social media, checking your email, or watching TV. Give your partner your undivided attention to make the most out of your time together.

3. Use programs that enable you to talk to them, such as the voice conversation feature of MSN or Skype or Facebook.
Using a program that allows you to communicate using your voice rather than just text can help you connect better with your partner.

4. Enforce the sense of closeness by asking him to play music for you over Voice Conversation, or using Voice Clips.
Using Voice Clips or playing music for each other can help create a sense of closeness, even if you're miles apart.

5. To keep the spice in the relationship, send each other random playful emails at unusual or unexpected times of the day.
Sending playful emails at unexpected times can keep things interesting and add some fun to your communication.

6. Remember important events, such as a test they've been stressing about, and email them a good luck card (plenty of websites allow you to do so for free).
Showing your partner that you're invested in their life and paying attention to their important events can go a long way in strengthening your relationship.

7. Play games together online.
Playing games online together can be a fun way to bond and spend time together, even if you can't be in the same physical space.

8. Consider making a joint email account if you don't want anyone else to accidentally read an email your significant other sends you or vice versa.
Creating a joint email account can help keep your communication private and avoid any potential mishaps.

9. Be romantic and send the other person random gifts.
Sending your partner random gifts can show them that you're thinking of them and add a special touch to your relationship.

10. Use MSN to your advantage or Facebook.
Utilizing social media and communication platforms like MSN or Facebook can help you stay connected and up-to-date on each other's lives.

11. Be involved in the other person's life.
Making an effort to be involved in your partner's life can help you stay connected and deepen your relationship.

12. Having a fight online is probably one of the worst things because it's so easy to cut someone out if Internet is the only connection between you two.
Try to avoid getting into arguments online, as it can be easy to cut someone out of your life when the only connection is online.

13. Limit joking/sarcasm to phone conversations.
Joking and sarcasm can be misinterpreted online, so try to limit it to phone conversations or in-person interactions.

14. Try each time you guys talk to make it interesting, don't make it look like a boring chat, or she/he will lose interest in you!
Making the effort to keep your conversations interesting and engaging can help keep the spark alive in your relationship.

prompt:
Rephrase the abstract of an article with title 'Halo-model signatures from 380,000 SDSS Luminous Red Galaxies with
  photometric redshifts'.
  We analyze the small-scale clustering in "MegaZ-LRG", a large
photometric-redshift catalogue of Luminous Red Galaxies extracted from the
imaging dataset of the Sloan Digital Sky Survey. MegaZ-LRG, presented in a
companion paper, spans the redshift range 0.4 < z < 0.7 with an r.m.s. redshift
error dz ~ 0.03(1+z), covering 5,914 deg^2 to map out a total cosmic volume 2.5
h^-3 Gpc^3. In this study we use 380,000 photometric redshifts to measure
significant deviations from the canonical power-law fit to the angular
correlation function in a series of narrow redshift slices, in which we
construct volume-limited samples. These deviations are direct signatures of the
manner in which these galaxies populate the underlying network of dark matter
haloes. We cleanly delineate the separate contributions of the "1-halo" and
"2-halo" clustering terms and fit our measurements by parameterizing the halo
occupation distribution N(M) of the galaxies. Our results are successfully fit
by a "central" galaxy contribution with a "soft" transition from zero to one
galaxies, combined with a power-law "satellite" galaxy component, the slope of
which is a strong function of galaxy luminosity. The large majority of galaxies
are classified as central objects of their host dark matter haloes rather than
satellites in more massive systems. The effective halo mass of MegaZ-LRG
galaxies lies in the range log_10 (M_eff / h^-1 M_sol) = 13.61 - 13.8
(increasing with redshift, assuming large-scale normalization sigma_8 = 0.8)
for corresponding number densities in the range n_g = 5.03 - 0.56 x 10^-4 h^3
Mpc^-3. Our results confirm the usefulness of the halo model for gaining
physical insight into the patterns of galaxy clustering.
text: In this work, we analyze the small-scale clustering of a photometric-redshift catalog of Luminous Red Galaxies known as "MegaZ-LRG", which spans redshifts from 0.4 to 0.7 and covers a cosmic volume of 2.5 h^-3 Gpc^3. By examining 380,000 photometric redshifts, we detect significant deviations from the canonical power-law fit to the angular correlation function within a series of narrow redshift slices. These deviations are attributed to the manner in which these galaxies inhabit dark matter haloes, leading to distinct "1-halo" and "2-halo" clustering terms. Our results are modeled by the halo occupation distribution and show that the majority of galaxies are primary citizens of their host dark matter haloes rather than satellites in more massive systems. The effective halo masses of MegaZ-LRG galaxies range from log_10 (M_eff / h^-1 M_sol) = 13.61 - 13.8 with corresponding number densities in the range of n_g = 5.03 - 0.56 x 10^-4 h^3 Mpc^-3. This analysis confirms the applicability of the halo model in deciphering physical information from the observed galaxy clustering.

prompt: Tulislah suatu artikel berita yang berjudul "Kemenhub Bangun Jembatan Timbang di Tol". Artikelnya harus mengandung paling tidak 300 kata dalam bahasa Indonesia.               Tambahkan "Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- " di awal artikel.
text: Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Kementerian Perhubungan Indonesia (Kemenhub) mengumumkan rencananya untuk membangun jembatan timbang di jalan tol. Hal ini dilakukan untuk meningkatkan keamanan dan kenyamanan dalam lalu lintas transportasi barang di jalan tol. Jembatan timbang ini didesain untuk menimbang berat kendaraan yang melintas di jalan tol. Dengan demikian, kendaraan yang melebihi kapasitas muatan yang diperbolehkan tidak akan diperkenankan untuk melanjutkan perjalanannya. Tujuannya adalah untuk mencegah terjadinya kecelakaan atau kerusakan jalan akibat kendaraan yang melebihi kapasitas muatan yang aman. Selain itu, jembatan timbang juga akan membantu pemerintah dalam melakukan pengawasan terhadap kendaraan-kendaraan yang tidak layak untuk beroperasi di jalan tol, seperti kendaraan yang sudah tua atau dalam kondisi rusak berat. Hal ini diharapkan dapat membantu menurunkan angka kecelakaan di jalan tol dan memperpanjang umur jalan tol yang ada. Kemenhub sendiri telah mencatat bahwa jumlah kendaraan yang melebihi kapasitas muatan yang diperbolehkan di jalan tol Indonesia masih cukup tinggi. Hal ini memberikan dampak negatif untuk kinerja jalan tol dan juga keamanan pengguna jalan. Dengan adanya jembatan timbang, diharapkan angka kendaraan yang melebihi kapasitas muatan yang diperbolehkan dapat menurun drastis. Jembatan timbang ini juga akan menjadi fasilitas bagi para pengusaha logistik dan transportasi barang. Mereka dapat memanfaatkan fasilitas ini untuk menimbang muatan kendaraan sebelum mereka melintasi jalan tol. Dengan demikian, mereka dapat memastikan bahwa kendaraan mereka tidak melebihi kapasitas muatan yang diperbolehkan dan juga sesuai dengan aturan yang telah ditetapkan. Proses pembangunan jembatan timbang ini sedang dalam tahap perencanaan dan Kemenhub sedang melakukan koordinasi dengan pihak manajemen jalan tol. Jembatan timbang ini akan dipasangkan di beberapa titik di jalan tol yang telah ditentukan. Kemenhub berharap bahwa pembangunan jembatan timbang ini dapat dilakukan dalam waktu dekat dan dapat segera beroperasi untuk meningkatkan keamanan dan kenyamanan lalu lintas di jalan tol.

prompt: Моля, генерирайте статия с дължина над 1000 символа и заглавие "Бяхме в Париж и ни сервираха тези френски охлювчета, още от първата хапка се влюбих в тях, веднага взех рецептата от готвача"
text:
Безспорно, френската кухня е една от най-известните в света. А когато се говори за нещата, които асоциираме с нея, едно от първите, които си идват наум, са охлювчетата. Нали? За някои от нас, включително мен, не е лесно да обичаме мекотата на тези животинки, но едно нещо е сигурно - при правилната приготовка могат да бъдат наистина вкусни.

Така че, когато се отправихме на пътешествие до Париж, знаехме, че трябва да опитаме тези френски деликатеси. И така, един ден, се изправихме пред едно малко кафене-ресторант, което имаше на масите си малки товарчета, пълни със зелени охлювчета.

Не без колебание, поръчахме по една порция. И макар да се страхувахме от този необичаен вкус, след първото жуване бяхме напълно в възторг. Охлювчетата бяха нежни и сочни, със силен и много приятен вкус. Безспорно, бяхме влюбени. Но какво става, когато се влюбим в храна? Започваме да търсим нейния оригинален вкус навсякъде.

След като се върнахме у дома, дадох себе си смелостта да опитам да приготвя охлювчета на същия начин, както го правят в Париж. Но къде да намеря свежи охлювчета в София? Ще трябва да ги купя замразени. След като намерих рецептата, която търсех, започнах да ги приготвям. След няколко опита най-накрая успях да ги приготвя, както трябва.

Ето нейната рецепта -

1. Необходими продукти:
- 500 грама замразени или свежи охлювчета
- 2 скилидки чесън, нарязани
- 2 с.л. масло
- 1 с.л. брашно
- 250 мл. бяло вино
- 1 с.л. червен пипер
- 1 ч.л. сол
- 1/2 ч.л. черен пипер
- 1/4 ч.л. мускатен орех

2. Подготовка:
- Загрейте фурната на 200 градуса.
- Измийте охлювчетата и оставете ги за около час да се промият във вода, сол и лимонов сок за да се отърват от земята и другите нечистотии.
- Избутайте половинките от чесъна и слагайте ги в тигана заедно с маслото.
- Накрая добавете брашното и разбъркайте, залейте бялото вино.
- След това прибавяйте охлювчетата, червения пипер, черения пипер и мускатения орех.
- Загрейте тигана за около 10 минути, докато сосът се стопи и се приближи до плътна консистенция.

3. Приготовление:
- След като сосът е готов, извадете го от тигана.
- След това поставете охлювчетата в тигана и ги печете около 10 минути.
- Накрая прибавете останалото количество нарязан чесън.

Страхотно се получи! Успях да ги искам отново. С наближаването на събития като Коледа, Нова Година и т.н., тези охлювчета биха били перфектния предястие. Идеализирани, деликатни, те ще осигурят един рус, но много приятен вкус.

Задачата беше трудна: да се мотивираме да опитаме нещо необичайно. Но нашият списък с "няма шанс" храни определено е по-кратък в следващия път, който ще докоснем нещо неопределено.

Какво мога да кажа? Френската кухня е все още наша любима. Бихме я опитали отново и отново.

prompt: What is a state comptroller ? Pretty much as simple as that , my state has an office called " the office of the comptroller " and I do n't really understand what that person does . Thanks ! Explain like I'm five.
text: A state comptroller is a government official who is responsible for managing the financial affairs of a state or local government. The comptroller's office is responsible for handling the government's money, including collecting taxes and fees, paying bills, and keeping track of how the government's money is being spent. The comptroller is often in charge of making sure that the government's financial transactions are conducted in an honest and transparent way, and that the government is using its money wisely. Comptrollers can also be responsible for auditing the government's financial records to make sure everything is accurate and in order. Essentially, the comptroller helps to make sure that the government has enough money to do what it needs to do, and that it is using that money wisely.

text: It's generally a good idea for college students to start thinking about saving and investing for their future. text:
["Overall, Incremental Network Quantization (INQ) presents a promising approach to reducing the compute and memory requirements of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) while maintaining high accuracy. The authors achieved this by incrementally quantizing the network's weights to lower numerics, which can be computed and stored more efficiently. This paper builds off of previous work in this field and advances the state of the art by introducing an INQ procesure that allows for lossless compression (i.e., achieves zero loss of accuracy relative to training with higher-precision weights) and efficiently transfers to new hardware.

The paper is well written and describes the method in detail, making it approachable to readers who may not be familiar with the specific domain. The authors provide comprehensive results from empirical experiments across multiple datasets and network architectures to show the effectiveness of their approach. The experiments show promising results and demonstrate that the INQ procedure can achieve a significant reduction in model size with minimal accuracy degradation.

There are a few suggestions I have for improvement. First, the authors could provide more insight into the impact of noise introduced by quantizing weights on the CNN's sensitivity, which has previously been shown to be important for model robustness. Additionally, it is not always clear from the explanations provided what exactly each of the steps in the INQ algorithm are doing, and more detailed explanations could be helpful.

Overall, this paper is a significant contribution to the field of CNN compression and provides valuable insights into accelerating neural networks. I would recommend it for publication with minor revisions.", 'The paper titled "Incremental Network Quantization: Towards Lossless CNNs with Low-precision Weights" addresses the issue of reducing the memory and computational requirements of deep convolutional neural networks (CNNs) without compromising their accuracy. The authors propose an approach to this problem by iteratively refining the network quantization process to reduce the bit-width of weights and activations, while maintaining the network's performance. 

One of the strengths of this paper is the thorough description of the proposed method, which is incremental network quantization, and how it has been optimized for CNNs. The authors have benchmarked their method on various datasets, including CIFAR-10, CIFAR-100, and ImageNet, and have provided detailed experimental results. The evaluation of the proposed method against state-of-the-art quantization techniques is also well-documented. 

However, one of the weaknesses of the paper is the lack of discussion on how the proposed method can be scaled to larger networks with more complex architectures and a higher number of layers. Furthermore, the authors have not provided any insight into the impact on the quantization of the CNNs' performance when using different activation functions or training techniques.

Overall, the approach presented in this paper is promising for reducing the number of bits required to encode weights and activations while maintaining the performance of deep CNNs. However, further exploration is required to understand the limitations of the proposed method, particularly its limited scalability and potential performance degradation under different training conditions.', 'Overall, the paper presents an innovative method called incremental network quantization (INQ) for converting pre-trained full-precision convolutional neural networks (CNNs) into low-precision versions with either power of two or zero weights. The paper presents a detailed description of the proposed method, including three interdependent operations, namely weight partition, group-wise quantization, and re-training. These operations are repeated iteratively on the latest re-trained group until all the weights are converted into low-precision ones, leading to incremental network quantization and accuracy enhancement. The paper reports extensive experiments using almost all known deep CNN architectures, including AlexNet, VGG-16, GoogleNet, and ResNets. The experimental results illustrate the efficacy of the proposed method, where the models have improved accuracy even at 5-bit quantization than the 32-bit floating-point references. Furthermore, impressive results with the combination of network pruning and INQ are also reported.

The paper is well-written, and the results are impressive. The proposed method seems to be very promising for converting pre-trained full-precision convolutional neural networks into low-precision versions, with either power of two or zero weights, without compromising the accuracy. Moreover, the proposed method is well-explained, making it easier to understand and apply. The experimental setup is well-designed, including a thorough evaluation of the proposed method, which provides confidence in the results. One minor concern is that the experimental set-up for the combination of network pruning and INQ is not discussed in detail, and it could be difficult for readers to replicate the results. However, this is only a minor concern, and the overall quality of the paper is high. Therefore, I recommend accepting the paper for publication.', 'This paper addresses the problem of efficiently converting pre-trained full-precision convolutional neural networks (CNNs) into low-precision versions with constrained weights. The authors propose a novel method called incremental network quantization (INQ) that can convert any pre-trained CNN model into a low-precision version whose weights are either powers of two or zero. This paper presents several strengths and weaknesses that are discussed below.

Strengths:
- The proposed method is an innovative way to achieve lossless CNNs with low-precision weights without noticeable accuracy loss. The authors introduce three interdependent operations that can convert pre-trained CNN models into low-precision models by iteratively quantizing the weights and re-training.
- The authors have provided extensive experimental results on several deep CNN architectures such as AlexNet, VGG-16, GoogleNet, and ResNets using the ImageNet classification task. The results show that their proposed method outperforms other existing methods and even performs better than the 32-bit floating-point references in some cases.
- The authors also demonstrate the effectiveness of their proposed method by combining it with network pruning, which further enhances the accuracy and reduces the number of parameters in the models.

Weaknesses:
- Although the authors claim that their proposed method can achieve lossless CNNs with low-precision weights without noticeable accuracy loss, it is unclear how much accuracy loss the method incurs when compared to full-precision models. The authors only compare their results to the 32-bit floating-point references, but do not provide any comparison to full-precision models.
- The proposed method involves multiple hyperparameters such as the quantization bit-width, the number of weight partitions, and the number of re-training iterations. While the authors have provided some guidelines for choosing these hyperparameters, it is not clear how sensitive the results are to these hyperparameters and how they affect the performance of the method.
- Finally, the authors do not provide any theoretical guarantee or proof of convergence for their iterative method, which may raise concerns about the robustness and generality of the proposed method.

Overall, this paper presents an innovative and effective solution for converting pre-trained CNN models into low-precision versions with constrained weights. The authors have demonstrated the effectiveness of their proposed method through extensive experiments on several deep CNN architectures. However, further investigation is required to address the limitations and concerns raised in this review.']

prompt: Why is moving the pawn in front of the king in chess , the most common first move ? What 's the point ? Why not move any of the other pieces first ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
Moving the pawn in front of the king is a common first move in chess because it helps to control the center of the board and develop the other pieces. The center of the board is important because it allows the pieces to move more easily and attack more squares. Developing the other pieces means getting them out of their starting positions and into more active roles on the board.

There are many different ways to start a game of chess, and different players may have their own preferences. Some players might choose to move a knight or bishop first, for example, to try to control key squares or attack the opponent's pieces. But moving the pawn in front of the king is a solid, safe choice that can set the stage for a strong opening.

prompt:
Rephrase the abstract of an article with title 'Redefining the Missing Satellites Problem'.
  Numerical simulations of Milky-Way size Cold Dark Matter (CDM) halos predict
a steeply rising mass function of small dark matter subhalos and a substructure
count that greatly outnumbers the observed satellites of the Milky Way. Several
proposed explanations exist, but detailed comparison between theory and
observation in terms of the maximum circular velocity (Vmax) of the subhalos is
hampered by the fact that Vmax for satellite halos is poorly constrained. We
present comprehensive mass models for the well-known Milky Way dwarf
satellites, and derive likelihood functions to show that their masses within
0.6 kpc (M_0.6) are strongly constrained by the present data. We show that the
M_0.6 mass function of luminous satellite halos is flat between ~ 10^7 and 10^8
M_\odot. We use the ``Via Lactea'' N-body simulation to show that the M_0.6
mass function of CDM subhalos is steeply rising over this range. We rule out
the hypothesis that the 11 well-known satellites of the Milky Way are hosted by
the 11 most massive subhalos. We show that models where the brightest
satellites correspond to the earliest forming subhalos or the most massive
accreted objects both reproduce the observed mass function. A similar analysis
with the newly-discovered dwarf satellites will further test these scenarios
and provide powerful constraints on the CDM small-scale power spectrum and warm
dark matter models.
text: In this article, we investigate the disparity between the number of observed satellites in the Milky Way and its predicted CDM mass function. We explore the maximum circular velocities (Vmax) of the Milky Way's luminous satellites and construct mass models in order to derive the likelihoods of their masses within 0.6 kpc (M_0.6). We then compare the flat M_0.6 mass function of luminous satellites to the steeply rising CDM subhalos mass function. After ruling out the hypothesis that the 11 well-known satellites are hosted by the 11 most massive subhalos, we show that models which account for the earliest-forming or most massive accreted objects better fit the observed mass function. We conclude that further analysis of newly-discovered dwarf satellites may provide additional powerful constraints on the CDM small-scale power spectrum and warm dark matter models.

prompt:
Rephrase the abstract of an article with title 'Rotation and activity of pre-main-sequence stars'.
  We present a study of rotation (vsini) and chromospheric activity (Halpha EW)
based on an extensive set of high-resolution optical spectra obtained with MIKE
on the 6.5m Magellan Clay telescope. Our targets are 74 F-M dwarfs in the young
stellar associations Eta Cha, TW Hydrae, Beta Pic, and Tuc-Hor, spanning ages
from 6 to 30 Myr. While the Halpha EW for most F and G stars are consistent
with pure photospheric absorption, most K and M stars show chromospheric
emission. By comparing Halpha EW in our sample to results in the literature, we
see a clear evolutionary sequence: Chromospheric activity declines steadily
from the T Tauri phase to the main sequence. Using activity as an age
indicator, we find a plausible age range for the Tuc-Hor association of 10-40
Myr. Between 5 and 30 Myr, we do not see evidence for rotational braking in the
total sample, thus angular momentum is conserved, in contrast to younger stars.
This difference indicates a change in the rotational regulation at 5-10 Myr,
possibly because disk braking cannot operate longer than typical disk
lifetimes, allowing the objects to spin up. The rotation-activity relation is
flat in our sample; in contrast to main-sequence stars, there is no linear
correlation for slow rotators. We argue that this is because young stars
generate their magnetic fields in a fundamentally different way from
main-sequence stars, and not just the result of a saturated solar-type dynamo.
By comparing our rotational velocities with published rotation periods for a
subset of stars, we determine ages of 13 (7-20) Myr and 9 (7-17} Myr for the
Eta Cha and TWA associations, respectively, consistent with previous estimates.
Thus we conclude that stellar radii from evolutionary models by Baraffe et al.
(1998) are in agreement with the observed radii within +-15%. (abridged)
text: We investigate the correlations between rotation and activity during pre-main-sequence (PMS) stellar evolution by analyzing an extensive set of optically high-resolution spectra of 74 F-M dwarfs in a range of young stellar associations ages 6 to 30 Myr. We observe a clear decline in chromospheric activity as the stars evolve from T Tauri to main sequence stars. Using activity as an age indicator and stellar radii from evolutionary models, we find a consistent age range of 10-40 Myr for the Tuc-Hor association, and 13 (7-20) and 9 (7-17) Myr for the Eta Cha and TWA associations, respectively. Our results indicate angular momentum is conserved between 5-30 Myr and that the rotation-activity relation for young stars is not correlated to lower-rotators like main-sequence stars, likely due to a different magnetic field generation mechanism. In short, we find observed stellar radii are in agreement with predicted radii within +/- 15% over this PMS evolutionary period.

prompt: Write a Wikipedia article with the title "Two Against the World (1932 film)", the article should at least have 250 words
text: Two Against the World is a 1932 romantic drama film directed by William Dieterle and starring Ruth Chatterton and Lewis Stone. The screenplay was written by S. K. Lauren, based on a story by Edwin Justus Mayer. It revolves around an unmarried couple who are wrongfully accused of a murder and sentenced to life in prison. As they struggle to prove their innocence, their love is tested. The film co-stars Lyle Talbot, Robert Warwick, and Frances Dee. It was released on March 11, 1932, by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer. Plot Gloria (Ruth Chatterton) is an aspiring actress touring the Midwest with her acting troupe. She meets and falls in love with Henry (Lewis Stone), a professor who is on a business trip, and moves in with him against the wishes of her domineering producer. When the producer is found murdered in Henry’s house, Gloria and Henry are framed for the crime. The two are sentenced to life in prison. While in prison, Gloria and Henry never lose hope and behind bars they continue to fight for their freedom. Henry begins filing paperwork for an appeal while Gloria works to build a case to prove their innocence. Despite their difficult circumstances, the couple’s bond grows stronger as they fight for justice. With the help of a friendly warden, the two are able to collect enough evidence to prove their innocence and they are both exonerated. The unconquerable love between Gloria and Henry endures and they are both freed. Reception Two Against the World was praised by film critics and audiences alike. The writing received notable praise, with one review noting “the story drawn from Mr. Mayer’s original ideas is unusual and daring.” The performance of its leads, Ruth Chatterton and Lewis Stone, was also commended. Chatterton was noted for her “stirring portrayal” while Stone was praised for his “special knack for portraying a hero.” The film was also a success at the box office, leading to MGM producing a sequel two years later, titled Escape from the Big House.
